member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType
member.summary: Enum values corresponding to every data type supported by the IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries provider.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2BigInt
member.summary: An 8-byte signed binary number with a precision of 19 digits.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Integer
member.summary: A 4-byte signed binary number with a precision of 10 digits.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2SmallInt
member.summary: A 2-byte signed binary number with a precision of 5 digits.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Decimal
member.summary: A packed decimal number with an implicit decimal point.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Numeric
member.summary: A zoned decimal number with an implicit decimal point.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Char
member.summary: A fixed-length character string that can contain single-byte data from a single-byte character set, UTF8 data from ccsid 1208, or mixed data from a mixed-byte character set.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2VarChar
member.summary: A variable-length character string that can contain single-byte data from a single-byte character set, UTF8 data from ccsid 1208, or mixed data from a mixed-byte character set.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2CharBitData
member.summary: A fixed-length character string whose data is normally not converted. The ccsid for this data type is 65535.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2VarCharBitData
member.summary: A variable-length character string whose data is normally not converted. The ccsid for this data type is 65535.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Graphic
member.summary: A double-byte, fixed-length character string which can contain DBCS data encoded in a DBCS CCSID, UTF16 data from ccsid 1200, or UCS-2 data encoded in the universal coded character set (13488).

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2VarGraphic
member.summary: A double-byte, variable-length character string which can contain DBCS data encoded in a DBCS CCSID, UTF16 data from ccsid 1200, or UCS-2 data encoded in the universal coded character set (13488).

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Date
member.summary: A date value that contains Year, Month, and Day elements.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Time
member.summary: A time value that contains Hour, Minute, and Second elements.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2TimeStamp
member.summary: A timestamp value that contains Year, Month, Day, Hour, Minute, Second, and Microsecond elements.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Rowid
member.summary: A value that uniquely identifies a row in a table.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Real
member.summary: A single-precision floating point number which is a 32-bit approximate representation of a real number.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Double
member.summary: A double-precision floating point number which is an IEEE 64-bit approximate representation of a real number.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Binary
member.summary: A fixed-length sequence of binary bytes.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2VarBinary
member.summary: A variable-length sequence of binary bytes.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Blob
member.summary: A variable-length sequence of binary bytes. used for storing large objects.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Clob
member.summary: A variable-length sequence of characters. used for storing large objects.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2DbClob
member.summary: A variable-length sequence of double-byte characters used for storing large objects.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2DataLink
member.summary: A variable length sequence of characters used for storing a logical reference (URL) to a file stored outside the database.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2DecFloat16
member.summary: An IEEE 754r number with a decimal point and a maximum precision of 16 digits.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2DecFloat34
member.summary: An IEEE 754r number with a decimal point and a maximum precision of 34 digits.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Xml
member.summary: A well-formed XML document, as defined in the XML 1.0 specification.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.IiDB2Nullable
member.summary: Provides a common interface used to handle nullable data types.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.IiDB2Nullable.IsNull
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the value of the object is null.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Searchable
member.summary: Enum value which indicates whether or not data in the column is searchable, and if so, with what options.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Searchable.Never
member.summary: Data in the column cannot be used in any WHERE clause.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Searchable.AllExceptLike
member.summary: Data in the column can be used in a WHERE clause with any comparison operator except LIKE.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Searchable.Always
member.summary: Data in the column can be used in a WHERE clause with any comparison operator.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Searchable.OnlyWithLike
member.summary: Data in the column can be used in a WHERE clause, but only with the LIKE predicate.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2GenerationMode
member.summary: Enum values which indicate whether or not data in the column is generated always, or by default. This only applies to Rowid and Identity columns.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2GenerationMode.Always
member.summary: Data in the column is always generated by DB2 for i.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2GenerationMode.ByDefault
member.summary: Data in the column is generated by default by DB2 for i.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader
member.summary: Provides a way to read a forward-only set of rows from the data source. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.para: The iDB2DataReader is used to read a forward-only set of result data that is returned from executing a SELECT statement, or from calling a stored procedure that returns one or more result sets. The iDB2DataReader is returned from a call to one of the iDB2Command.ExecuteReader() methods.

listheader.description: The iDB2DataReader object is created by the Managed Provider as a result of running one of the iDB2Command.ExecuteReader methods

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an IEnumerator used to enumerate through the result set.
member.remarks: This is especially useful for a Web Forms-based DataGrid where a Data Reader can be directly bound as a DataSource.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.Close
member.summary: Closes the iDB2DataReader.
member.remarks: Once the Data Reader is closed, the command is freed for processing more commands.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.NextResult
member.summary: Advances the iDB2DataReader to the next result set.
member.returns: True if there are more result sets; otherwise false.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.Read
member.summary: Advances the iDB2DataReader to the next record.
member.remarks: If a record is successfully read, True is returned. False means either no records exist, or the last record was already read and the reader is positioned past the end of the table.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Parameter.Scale

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Parameter.Size
member.summary: Maximum size of the parameter.
member.remarks: The Size property is used for binary and string types. For variable length data types, this is the maximum amount of data to transmit to the data source. For non-string data types and ANSI string data, this is the number of bytes. For Unicode string data, Size refers to the number of characters. The count for strings does not include the terminating character. If not explicitly set, the size is inferred from the actual size of the specified parameter value. For fixed width data types, the value of Size is ignored. It can be retrieved for informational purposes, and returns the maximum amount of bytes the provider uses when transmitting the value of the parameter to the data source.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Xml
member.summary: Represents data containing a well-formed XML document, as defined in the XML 1.0 specification. This corresponds to the DB2 for i XML data type.
member.remarks:
Like other DB2 for i data types that represent text, XML data is tagged with a CCSID. The recommended CCSID for use on the IBM i is UTF-8 (CCSID 1208). The CCSID value for an XML column can be specified for example on a CREATE TABLE statement. For XML data stored on the IBM i, the column CCSID is referred to as the external encoding.
XML data can also include an internal encoding tag stored within the XML header portion of the document itself.
When an XML document contains an internal encoding tag, the internal encoding must match the external encoding.
This has implications for sending and receiving XML data between the .NET application and the IBM i. For example, if an iDB2Xml object is constructed from a String, either the String data must not contain an internal encoding, or the internal encoding must match the .NET Framework String data type, which is UTF-16, Little-Endian.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder
member.summary: Provides a way to create and manage connection strings used by the iDB2Connection class.
member.remarks: The iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder class can be used to build and edit a ConnectionString for use with an iDB2Connection object. The iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder supports only key/value pairs that are supported by the IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries provider.

member.param: The value used to initialize the iDB2Connection object's ConnectionString.

member.summary: Gets an ICollection that contains all the values in the iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder.LobBlockSize
member.summary: A value which indicates the number of megabytes the provider should read or write at one time when sending or receiving large object (LOB) data in pieces, and when using XML. Note, the actual amount of data sent or received at one time may vary from this number.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder.XmlStripWhitespace
member.summary: A value which indicates whether whitespace characters should be preserved or removed from XML data before returning it to the application. Whitespace characters are characters added to improve readability of an XML document and include the blank, carriage return, line feed, and tab characters. Boundary whitespace characters (whitespace between elements) are not removed or affected by this property.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder.MaximumDecimalPrecision
member.summary: A value which indicates the maximum precision that should be used by the host server program for result data types when performing arithmetic operations on decimal or numeric data.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder.MaximumDecimalScale
member.summary: A value which indicates the maximum scale that should be used by the host server program for result data types when performing arithmetic operations on decimal or numeric data.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder.MinimumDivideScale
member.summary: A value which indicates the minimum scale that should be used by the host server program for result data types when performing decimal division operations.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder.MaximumInlineLobSize
member.summary: Maximum size, in KB, of a LOB column which can be transferred in a single operation. LOB columns larger than this will use LOB locators.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder.MaximumPoolSize
member.summary: The largest number of pooled connections matching the ConnectionString which can be opened at any one time. A value of -1 indicates no maximum.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder.MaximumUseCount
member.summary: The maximum number of times a connection will be used before it is removed from the connection pool.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder.MinimumPoolSize
member.summary: The smallest number of pooled connections matching the ConnectionString which will be maintained by the provider.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder.Naming
member.summary: The naming convention to use for SQL requests. Naming also affects how unqualified object names are resolved.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder.NumericErrorOption
member.summary: Option for specifying how to handle invalid decimal data and divide by zero errors.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder.Password
member.summary: The Password used to connect to the data source.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder.PersistSecurityInfo
member.summary: Specifies whether sensitive Password information should be returned when requested from the iDB2Connection object. Password information is always returned from the iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder if it has been set.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder.Pooling
member.summary: A value which indicates whether or not connection pooling is enabled.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder.QueryOptimizeGoal
member.summary: The optimization goal for queries.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder.QueryStorageLimit

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder.QueryOptionsFileLibrary

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder.SortSequence

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Trace
member.summary: Provides a trace/log facility for the IBM DB2 for i .NET Provider.
member.remarks: If your code uses special formatting or string building to produce trace data, then you should first check the Tracing or Logging property. This will allow your code to perform better in cases where tracing or logging is not on, since you won't go through the extra formatting or string building code which would end up being ignored.

member.summary: A string value that describes the exception. This property is read-only.

member.summary: A String value that contains the SQLSTATE returned from the IBM i. This property will only return useful information for SQL errors. This property is read-only.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection
member.summary: Represents a connection to an IBM DB2 for i data source. This class cannot be inherited.
member.remarks: The iDB2Connection is used to create a connection to IBM DB2 for i for database operations. To make a connection to the system, an application must set the ConnectionString property, and specify at a minumum the DataSource name. The ConnectionString consists of a list of name=value pairs, separated by semicolons. An easy way to build a ConnectionString is by using the iDB2ConnectionStringBuilder class. In order to protect sensitive information in your ConnectionString, such as the userid and password used for connecting to the system, an application can store encrypted information in the web.config or app.config file.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the iDB2Connection class with all of the connection properties set to their default values.

remarks.para: If this version of the constructor is used, callers must set the ConnectionString property before calling iDB2Connection.Open().
See ConnectionString property in the iDB2Connection properties topic for a list of valid connection string values.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the iDB2Connection class and initializes the connection properties to the values specified in the provided connectionString.
member.param: The ConnectionString used to initialize the connection.
member.remarks: See ConnectionString property in the iDB2Connection properties topic for a list of valid connection string values.

member.summary: Change the Database (IASP) for the connection. The only time the Database can be changed is in the ConnectionString before the connection is opened. If the dbName parameter passed to ChangeDatabase is the same name as the database we connected to, then no error will occur. If the dbName parameter is different from the database we connected to, then an exception will be thrown.
member.param: The Database (IASP) to use for this connection.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets or sets the string used to initialize the connection. This property is read-only after the connection has been opened.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary: Gets the number of seconds (0-3600) to wait for the Open request to complete before terminating with an error. A value of 0 indicates no timeout (wait indefinitely).
member.remarks: This ConnectionTimeout property does not affect how long the TCP/IP communication stack waits before giving up. It only specifies how long the IBM i Access for Windows communication component waits. It is possible that the TCP/IP connection could expire before hitting the timeout value specified by this property.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.Database
member.summary: Gets the name of the Database (IASP) for this connection.

remarks.para: String value up to 18-characters long, specifying the name of the database (IASP) to which the Managed Provider connects.

If no value is specified for Database, the database will be determined from the job description. If *SYSBAS is specified, the connection will be made to the system ASP / *LOCAL RDB. If a specific Database value is set, and the connection cannot be made to that database, then the connection will fail with an iDB2ConnectionFailed exception.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.DataSource
member.summary: Gets the name of the data source for this connection.
member.remarks: String value specifying the name of the IBM i host to connect to. This can be a simple system name, a tcp/ip address, or a fully-qualified name.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.ServerVersion
member.summary:
Gets the IBM DB2 for i server version. The version is returned in the form:
vv.rr.mmmm
where vv is the version, rr is the release, and mmmm is the modification.
For example:
07010000 corresponds to 7.1

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.State
member.summary: Gets the current state of this connection.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.Provider
member.summary: Gets the name of the provider.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.UserID
member.summary: Gets the User Id for this connection.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.Password
member.summary: Gets the Password used to connect to the data source.
member.remarks: If the PersistSecurityInfo property is set to true, and the password was specified in the ConnectionString, then the password is returned. Otherwise, an empty string is returned.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.PersistSecurityInfo
member.summary: Indicates whether Password information is returned when requested. By default, Password information is sensitive and cannot be retrieved, either in the ConnectionString or by accessing the Password property.

remarks.para: Boolean value that specifies whether the Password property can be read by the application. When PersistSecurityInfo is false, reading the ConnectionString property will result in a string that does not contain a "Password=pwd" value, and reading the Password property will result in an empty string.

When PersistSecurityInfo is true, the resulting behavior depends on whether the Password was specified in the ConnectionString. If the Password was specified in the ConnectionString, then reading the ConnectionString property and reading the Password property will result in the Password being returned. If the Password was not specified in the ConnectionString, the Password will not be returned.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.SSL
member.summary: Gets a boolean value which indicates whether data is encrypted when going to and from the data source.
member.remarks: If the SSL property is not specified, the SSL property is inherited from the default configured for the connection.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.DataCompression
member.summary: Gets a boolean value which indicates whether large data streams are compressed when going to and from the data source.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.SortSequence
member.summary: Gets a value which indicates how the host server program will sort records before returning them to the client.
member.remarks: If SharedWeight or UniqueWeight is specified, the SortLanguageId property must be set to a 3-character language ID. If UserSpecified is specified, the SortTable property must be set to the name of a sort sequence table.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.SortLanguageId
member.summary: Gets a string containing the 3-character language id used by the host server program to sort records before returning them to the client.

remarks.para: A 3-character String value which indicates the language ID to use for SortSequence. When SortSequence is set to UniqueWeight or SharedWeight, this property is required. Otherwise, it is ignored. The possible values for SortLangageId are:

AFR, ARA, BEL, BGR, CAT, CHS, CHT, CSY, DAN, DES, DEU, ELL, ENA, ENB, ENG, ENP, ENU, ESP, EST, FAR, FIN, FRA, FRB, FRC, FRS, GAE, HEB, HRV, HUN, ISL, ITA, ITS, JPN, KOR, LAO, LVA, LTU, MKD, NLB, NLD, NON, NOR, PLK, PTB, PTG, RMS, ROM, RUS, SKY, SLO, SQI, SRB, SRL, SVE, THA, TRK, UKR, URD, VIE.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.SortTable
member.summary: Gets a string containing the name of the sort table used by the host server program to sort records before returning them to the client.
member.remarks:
When SortSequence is set to UserSpecified, this property is required. Otherwise, it is ignored.
The SortTable must be specified in the form LIBRARY/TABLE. The LIBRARY and TABLE names must be less than or equal to 10 characters each.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.HexParserOption
member.summary: Gets a value which indicates how hexadecimal constants will be interpreted by the host server program.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.MaximumDecimalPrecision
member.summary: Gets a value which indicates the maximum precision that should be used by the host server program for result data types when performing arithmetic operations on decimal or numeric data.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.MaximumDecimalScale
member.summary: Gets a value which indicates the maximum scale that should be used by the host server program for result data types when performing arithmetic operations on decimal or numeric data.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.MinimumDivideScale
member.summary: Gets a value which indicates the minimum scale that should be used by the host server program for result data types when performing decimal division operations.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.DefaultCollection
member.summary: Gets the name of the library (collection) used for unqualified SQL requests.
member.remarks: String value which specifies the collection (library or schema) to use for unqualified SQL statements. Case-sensitive names must be enclosed in double-quotes.

value.para: The default value is an empty string.

If not specified in the ConnectionString, then after the connection is made, DefaultCollection is set to the User ID that made the connection if SQL naming is in effect. If System naming is being used, DefaultCollection is set only if the application explicitly sets it in the ConnectionString.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.AutocommitIsolationLevel
member.summary: Gets the IsolationLevel to use when in autocommit mode. Autocommit mode is used when an application is not processing a transaction.
member.remarks: System.Data.IsolationLevel enumeration value that specifies the isolation level to use when performing operations outside of a transaction (in autocommit mode).

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.DefaultIsolationLevel
member.summary: Gets the default IsolationLevel to use when starting a transaction.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.Pooling
member.summary: Gets a boolean value which indicates whether or not connection pooling is enabled.
member.remarks:
Boolean value indicating whether or not to enable connection pooling for this connection.
True means the connection is taken from the matching connection pool, if it exists. If the pool does not exist it is created, and the minimum pool size is maintained.
False means the connection is not taken from or returned to any pool.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.MinimumPoolSize
member.summary: Gets the smallest number of pooled connections matching the ConnectionString which will be maintained by the provider.

remarks.para: Int32 value which specifies the smallest number of pooled connections to keep on hand that match this connection.

This many connections will be created the first time a connection is made with the specified connection string, so if MinimumPoolSize is set to a value other than 0, a longer delay than expected may occur as the extra connections are created.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.MaximumPoolSize
member.summary: Gets the largest number of pooled connections matching the ConnectionString which can be opened at any one time. A value of -1 indicates no maximum.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.MaximumUseCount
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of times a connection will be used before it is removed from the connection pool.

remarks.para: Integer value which specifies the maximum number of times a connection may be used before it is removed from the pool.

When a connection is about to be returned to the pool of available connections, the maximum use count is checked. If the maximum is reached, then the connection is closed and not returned to the pool. Instead, a new connection is created and inserted into the pool of available connections.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.Trace
member.summary: Gets a combination of iDB2TraceOptions enum values which specifies if or how host traces are used with this connection.
member.remarks: Multiple trace options may be added together to select multiple options. Trace should only be used when debugging problems or when recommended by support, because it will adversely affect performance.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.QueryOptionsFileLibrary
member.summary: Gets the name of the library (collection) for the query options file to use with this connection.

remarks.para: String value which specifies a query options file library. When this property is specified, the Managed Provider issues a CHGQRYA command and passes the QueryOptionsFileLibrary name for the QRYOPTLIB parameter where the QAQQINI file resides.
The user profile used for the connection must have authority to the CHGQRYA command and the QAQQINI file residing in the specified QueryOptionsFileLibrary.
It is recommended that this property is only used when debugging problems or when recommended by support because it adversely affects performance.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.JobName
member.summary: Gets the host server job name associated with this open connection.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.Naming
member.summary: Gets the naming convention to use for SQL requests. Naming also affects how unresolved objects are found.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.MaximumInlineLobSize
member.summary: Gets the maximum size (in kilobytes) of a LOB column which can be retrieved from the host server in a single operation.

remarks.para: Int32 value in the range 0-15360 which specifies the maximum size (in kilobytes) of a LOB (large object) column which can be retrieved from the host server in a single operation.

LOB columns larger than this maximum will always be retrieved in pieces, requiring more round-trips to the host server. LOB columns smaller than this maximum will be retrieved as "inline" data, with no extra trips to the host required.

Smaller values for MaximumInlineLobSize may increase the frequency of communication to the host server for large LOBs, but may allow an application to consume less memory if the LOB data is read in pieces, for instance using iDB2DataReader.GetBytes() or iDB2GetChars().
Setting this value to 0 will cause LOB data to always be retrieved from the host server in pieces.
The LobBlockSize property controls the size of each piece.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.LobBlockSize
member.summary: Gets the number of megabytes the provider will read or write at one time when sending or receiving Large Object (LOB) data in pieces, and when using XML. Note, the actual amount of data sent or received at one time may vary from this number.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.XmlStripWhitespace
member.summary: Gets a value which indicates whether whitespace characters should be preserved or removed from XML data before returning it to the application. Whitespace characters are characters added to improve readability of an XML document and include the blank, carriage return, line feed, and tab characters. Boundary whitespace characters (whitespace between elements) are not removed or affected by this property.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.LibraryList
member.summary: Gets the user portion of the library list for the host server job.

remarks.para: String value which specifies the user portion of the library list for the host server job. LibraryList is a list of library names, separated by commas.

The list can include the special library name *USRLIBL. *USRLIBL is a placeholder for the library list associated with the user profile of the current host server job. By placing other library names before or after *USRLIBL, the application can control the order in which these libraries are referenced.

If *USRLIBL is not included in the LibraryList, the library list associated with the user profile of the current host server job is replaced. To add to the library list, not replace it, the application must specify *USRLIBL somewhere in the LibraryList.
Case-sensitive names in the LibraryList must be enclosed in double-quotes.
The Database host server always includes the user profile's current library setting in the job library list.

The provider does not automatically include the DefaultCollection in the library list. If the application wants the DefaultCollection added to the library list, it must set it using the LibraryList property.

listheader.description: This property is intended to be used with system library names. Attempting to use long schema names with this property may result in errors.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.CheckConnectionOnOpen
member.summary: Gets a boolean value which indicates whether or not the provider should check the validity of pooled connections when opening them.
member.remarks: Boolean value which specifies that the provider should check pooled connections before using them on a .Open() connection request. To verify that the connection is still active, the provider sends a small amount of data to the host. If the connection is no longer active, the provider attempts to start a new connection to the server.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.QueryOptimizeGoal
member.summary: Gets the optimization goal for queries.
member.remarks: Setting this property corresponds to the QAQQINI option OPTIMIZATION_GOAL. If the SQL statement contains an optimization goal (for instance, OPTIMIZE FOR nnn ROWS), then that optimization goal will be honored regardless of how this property is set.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.QueryStorageLimit
member.summary: Gets the temporary storage limit for queries.

remarks.para: An Int32 value in the range 0-2147352578 that specifies the maximum amount of temporary storage (in megabytes) the query can consume before ending the attempt and generating an error.

When a query is run, this value is checked against an estimated amount of temporary storage required to run the query. If the estimated storage requirement is greater than the QueryStorageLimit, then the query is not started, and an error occurs. When a value of 0 is specified, most database queries will exceed the temporary storage limit and generate an error.
A value of -1 indicates no maximum limit will be used.
This property corresponds to the QRYSTGLMT parameter of the CHGQRYA (Change Query Attributes) command.

listheader.description: This property is valid only for 6.1 and later hosts.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.NumericErrorOption
member.summary: Gets the option for handling numeric and divide by zero errors.

remarks.para: Integer value that specifies how the application wants numeric data errors to be handled for the connection. This property deals with two different types of error conditions:

item.description: How to handle the "decimal data error" condition, caused by numeric data that is not valid in a decimal or numeric field. This condition can happen, for instance, when a file is migrated from an older operating system environment (S/36) which allowed nonnumeric data in a numeric field.
How to handle the "divide by zero" condition.

remarks.para: Possible values:

item.description: The server will try to convert numeric data that is not valid to a number. Divide by zero errors generate a data mapping error.
Numeric data that is not valid will be returned as zero. Divide by zero errors generate a data mapping error.

The server will try to convert numeric data that is not valid to a number. Divide by zero errors will generate a null value instead of a data mapping error. This value is only valid if the IBM i host is 6.1 or later.
Numeric data that is not valid will be returned as zero. Divide by zero errors will generate a null value instead of a data mapping error.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.DecfloatRoundingMode
member.summary: Gets the option for setting the decimal float rounding mode.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.DecfloatErrorOption
member.summary: Gets the option for reporting decimal float errors.

remarks.para: Integer value that specifies how the application wants decimal floating point errors to be handled for the connection.
0: return as a data mapping error
1: return as a warning only
Because the .NET provider does not return host warnings to the application, using a value of 1 has the effect of ignoring decimal floating point errors.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.ApplicationName
member.summary: Gets the name of the running application.

remarks.para: String value that specifies the name of the application using the .NET provider. If not set, the provider will determine the name of the .EXE file for the application, and set the property to that value.
The ApplicationName is passed to the IBM i program, and is used there for accounting purposes only. The system saves this information into the CLIENT_APPLNAME special register.

value.para: After connection, if not set by the application, this is set to the name of the application's .EXE file.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.XaLockTimeout
member.summary: Specifies the maximum amount of time (in seconds) that a distributed transaction will wait on a lock request before timing out.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.XaTransactionTimeout

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.BlockSize
member.summary: Specifies the block size (number of kilobytes) used to fetch data.

remarks.para: Int32 value that specifies how much data the provider should fetch each time it retrieves data from the host. The actual amount of data retrieved might be different from this number, depending on the size of each row and whether LOB locators are being used.
BlockSize must be a value between 0 and 8192, and indicates the number of kilobytes to fetch at one time. A value of 0 means the default host blocking size will be used

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.SchemaSearchList
member.summary: Contains a list of schemas to search when GetSchemaTable() is called without passing a SchemaName restriction value.

remarks.para: A string value which specifies the list of schemas to include when GetSchema() is called without a schema restriction value. When there is a large number of IBM i objects, enumerating them via GetSchema() is sometimes a time-consuming operation. GetSchema() provides a way to restrict the list of objects returned, but some automated tools do not use this restriction support. SchemaSearchList enables the application to have more control over the search list.

SchemaSearchList is a comma-delimited list of schema names. The names can contain the special value *USRLIBL, which is a placeholder to indicate the host server job's current user portion of the library list. If the library list includes a 10-character system name equivalent of a long SQL schema name, then the *USRLIBL feature of SchemaSearchList will not work correctly, because the system catalogs queried by GetSchemaTable() reference the long SQL schema name, not the shortened system name. To use long SQL schema names with SchemaSearchList, specify them explicitly in the list instead of relying on their values being set in the library list.

The list can also contain the special value *ALL, which is used to force the list to return all schemas on the system. Use of *ALL is not recommended because it can cause serious performance delays when using GetSchema().
Case-sensitive names in the search list are surrounded by double-quotes.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Command
member.summary: Represents a SQL statement to execute against an IBM DB2 for i data source. This class cannot be inherited.
member.remarks: The iDB2Command is used to execute SQL commands and stored procedure calls to IBM DB2 for i. This class provides several different methods for executing commands. When iDB2Command.ExecuteReader is used to generate an iDB2DataReader for reading result data, the iDB2DataReader must be closed before the associated iDB2Command can be used to execute another command.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Command.AddBatch
member.summary: Adds the current row of parameter data to an internal cache of parameters. The cached parameter data will be sent to the host when an execute method is called.
member.remarks: Only parameterized statements containing no LOB or XML parameters can be added to the batch; otherwise, AddBatch will throw an InvalidOperation exception. Rows of cached parameter data are held until the command is executed, after which the cache is cleared and the command reverts back to a non-cached command.
member.seealso: Performing multi-row INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE and MERGE using AddBatch

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Command.ResetCommandTimeout
member.summary: Resets the CommandTimeout property to its default value.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Command.Cancel
member.summary: Attempts to cancel execution of the command.

remarks.para: If there is nothing to cancel, nothing happens. If there is a command in progress, and the attempt to cancel fails, no exception is generated.
Note: The .NET Provider cannot cancel a command in-progress, so this method is in effect a no-op.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Command.CreateDbParameter
member.summary: Creates a new instance of a DbParameter object.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Command.CreateParameter
member.summary: Creates a new instance of an iDB2Parameter object. The parameter does NOT get added to the command's Parameters collection unless the parameter is added using one of the command's Parameters.Add methods.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Command.ExecuteNonQuery
member.summary: Executes the command and ignores any result set.

remarks.para: For Insert, Update, and Delete statements, the return value is the number of rows affected. For all other statement types, the return value is -1.

If the command is executed on an iDB2Connection with an active iDB2Transaction, and the command's Transaction property has not been set to the same iDB2Transaction object, an InvalidOperationException is thrown.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Command.ExecuteReader
member.summary: Executes the command and returns an iDB2DataReader object.

remarks.para: If the command does not generate a result set, then the resulting iDB2DataReader's Read() method returns false.

If the command is executed on an iDB2Connection with an active iDB2Transaction, and the command's Transaction property has not been set to the same iDB2Transaction object, an InvalidOperationException is thrown.

While the iDB2DataReader is in use (until it is closed), the associated iDB2Command is busy serving the iDB2DataReader. While in this state (until the iDB2DataReader is closed), none of the iDB2Command's Execute or Prepare methods can be called, or an InvalidOperationException will result.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Command.ExecuteDbDataReader(System.Data.CommandBehavior)
member.summary: Executes the command using the specified CommandBehavior and returns a DbDataReader object.
member.param: A value which specifies options for returning information for the result set.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Command.ExecuteReader(System.Data.CommandBehavior)
member.summary: Executes the command using the specified CommandBehavior and returns an iDB2DataReader object.
member.param: A value which specifies options for returning information for the result set.

remarks.para: Executes the command and returns an iDB2DataReader object using the specified CommandBehavior (System.Data.CommandBehavior) enumeration value. If the command does not generate a result set, then the resulting iDB2DataReader's Read() method returns false.

If the command is executed on an iDB2Connection with an active iDB2Transaction, and the command's Transaction property has not been set to the same iDB2Transaction object, an InvalidOperationException is thrown.

While the iDB2DataReader is in use (until it is closed), the associated iDB2Command is busy serving the iDB2DataReader. While in this state (until the iDB2DataReader is closed), none of the iDB2Command's Execute or Prepare methods can be called, or an InvalidOperationException will result.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Command.ExecuteScalar
member.summary: Executes the command and returns the first column of the first row in the result set.
member.returns: The first column of the first row in the result set. Returns a null reference if the result set is empty.

remarks.para: Executes the command, and returns the first column of the first row in the result set. Extra columns or rows are ignored. This method is a quick way to retrieve a single value from the database, without having the overhead of using a DataReader.
If the command does not generate a result set, then the method returns a null reference.

If the command is executed on an iDB2Connection with an active iDB2Transaction, and the command's Transaction property has not been set to the same iDB2Transaction object, an InvalidOperationException is thrown.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Command.ExecuteXmlReader
member.summary: Executes the command and returns the first column of the first row as an XmlReader. This method is only valid for XML fields.
member.returns: An XmlReader object corresponding to the XML data read from the result set.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Command.Prepare
member.summary: Prepares the command for execution on the data source.

remarks.para: Prepares the command for execution on the system. If the CommandText is changed after calling Prepare(), the statement is returned to the unprepared state.

Note that the application is not required to call Prepare() because DeriveParameters() and the various Execute methods perform an implicit Prepare to the host server. Prepare is useful, however, when a command is to be executed more than once.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Command.DeriveParameters
member.summary: Populates the command with an iDB2ParameterCollection that contains parameter descriptions. These derived parameters will replace any existing parameters for the command.

remarks.para: DeriveParameters() will first clear the existing parameter collection, do an implicit prepare, and (re)create the parameter collection.
If the CommandText is changed after calling DeriveParameters(), the statement is returned to the unprepared state.
DeriveParameters() is the recommended way of generating the Parameters collection.

member.param: A boolean value which indicates whether to release only unmanaged resources (false), or both managed and unmanaged resources (true).

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Command.UseOptimisticUpdateColumns
member.summary: A value used by the iDB2CommandBuilder when generating Update and Delete statements for use with ConflictOption.CompareRowVersion.

remarks.para: A boolean value used by the iDB2CommandBuilder when generating Update and Delete statements for use with ConflictOption.CompareRowVersion. When this property is set to true, additional data is retrieved from the host in order to detect conflicting changes to the data source during Update and Delete operations.

Applications that use cached Update and Delete statements generated by the iDB2CommandBuilder may need to set UseOptimisticUpdateColumns to true if the iDB2CommandBuilder is not used to generate statements at runtime.
This property is only supported on servers running 6.1 and later. When using the property on an earlier host version, the property is ignored.

member.remarks: Int32 value indicating the number of seconds to wait for the command to execute, before terminating and generating an error. A value of 0 means no timeout; an attempt to execute a command will wait indefinitely.

This contains all the parameters for the command.
Parameters are added to the collection by calling iDB2Command.DeriveParameters(), iDB2CommandBuilder.DeriveParameters(), or iDB2Command.Parameters.Add().

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Command.Transaction
member.summary: Gets or sets the iDB2Transaction in which the command executes.
member.remarks: The iDB2Transaction in which the command executes. This iDB2Command object and the specified iDB2Transaction object must both be connected to the same iDB2Connection object. Otherwise, when the command executes, an InvalidOperationException is generated.

value.para: Null reference if the command is created on an iDB2Connection that has no active transaction.

If the command is created using iDB2Connection.CreateCommand(), and the creating connection has an active transaction, then the Transaction property is automatically initialized to the connection's Transaction object.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ProviderSettings
member.summary: Provides a way to set process-global provider settings. The properties of this class can be overridden on a per-connection basis by setting the corresponding properties on the iDB2Connection object's ConnectionString. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ProviderSettings.CleanupPooledConnections
member.summary: Performs orderly cleanup of pooled connections. Calling this method just before your process terminates will ensure pooled iDB2Connections get cleaned up properly. Make this method the last call you make before your process terminates.
member.remarks: In some cases, the .NET Framework does not allow finalizers sufficient time to perform proper cleanup. An example of when this might happen is when you have started host traces using one of the iDB2TraceOptions in your ConnectionString. If the pooled connection finalizers are not allowed to run to completion, you could end up with host trace objects that do not get cleaned up properly.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ProviderSettings.ProviderVersion
member.summary: Returns the IBM DB2 for i .NET provider's AssemblyFileVersion.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ProviderSettings.DateTimeAsString
member.summary: Allows parameters and data columns of type iDB2Date, iDB2Time, and iDB2TimeStamp to be treated as Strings instead of as DateTime.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ProviderSettings.DecNumericAsString
member.summary: Allows parameters and data columns of type iDB2Decimal, iDB2Numeric, iDB2DecFloat16, and iDB2DecFloat34 to be treated as Strings instead of as Decimal.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ProviderSettings.CharBitDataAsString
member.summary: Allows parameters and data columns of type iDB2CharBitData and iDB2VarCharBitData to be treated as Strings instead of as a byte array.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ProviderSettings.CharBitDataCcsid
member.summary: Specifies the CCSID used to translate iDB2CharBitData and iDB2VarCharBitData types when the CharBitDataAsString property is set to True. This property is ignored when CharBitDataAsString is set to False.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ProviderSettings.TransactionCompletionTimeout
member.summary: Provides more time to allow distributed transactions to complete, in the event process termination occurs before transactions have been fully committed. Because the actual work of committing a distributed transaction may take longer than the process termination code is allowed to run, this property allows the provider to delay process termination for the specified amount of time, to give distributed transactions more time to complete. The timeout value is specified in seconds.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2CommandBuilder
member.summary: Provides a way to automatically generate Insert, Update, and Delete commands to execute against a data source. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.para: This iDB2CommandBuilder is used to build iDB2Command objects for use with the iDB2DataAdapter. To use the iDB2CommandBuilder, the SelectCommand property of its associated iDB2DataAdapter must be initialized to a select command that returns columns from a single table. The table MUST contain at least one primary key or unique column, or an InvalidOperationException is generated. Primary keys are recommended, because unique constraints allow nullable key fields, which can cause multiple rows to be affected by update or delete statements. After using the iDB2CommandBuilder to generate the Insert/Update/Delete commands, the SelectCommand should not be changed. If it is changed, you must call RefreshSchema in order to get updated commands that reflect the new Select statement. If the InsertCommand, UpdateCommand, or DeleteCommand of an iDB2DataAdapter is already set, the command builder will not change their values.

The iDB2CommandBuilder uses the iDB2Connection and iDB2Transaction objects associated with SelectCommand of the iDB2DataAdapter. A valid iDB2Connection must be associated with the SelectCommand in order to retrieve column information from the server.

member.summary: Given a quoted identifier, returns the correct unquoted form of that identifier, including properly un-escaping any embedded quotes in the identifier.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2CommandBuilder.GetSchemaTable(System.Data.Common.DbCommand)
member.summary: Returns a DataTable containing schema information for the iDB2CommandBuilder.
member.param: The DbCommand to retrieve the schema information for.
member.returns: A DataTable that represents the schema information for the iDB2CommandBuilder.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2CommandBuilder.DataAdapter
member.summary: Gets or sets the iDB2DataAdapter associated with this CommandBuilder.
member.remarks: If setting the DataAdapter property, any existing iDB2CommandBuilder object associated with the iDB2DataAdapter is released.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2CommandBuilder.QuotePrefix
member.summary: Gets a string value which is the beginning character to use when specifying table or column names. This QuotePrefix should only be used when specifying a name that contains special characters. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2CommandBuilder.QuoteSuffix
member.summary: Gets a string value which is the ending character to use when specifying table or column names. This QuoteSuffix should only be used when specifying a name that contains special characters. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2CommandBuilder.CatalogLocation
member.summary: Gets the CatalogLocation for this iDB2CommandBuilder.
member.remarks: The CatalogLocation indicates the position of the catalog name in a qualified table name in a text command.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2CommandBuilder.CatalogSeparator
member.summary: Gets the string used as the catalog separator for this iDB2CommandBuilder. The value returned depends on the naming convention specified in the ConnectionString (System or SQL).
member.value: Default: "." or "/" depending on the iDB2Connection Naming property.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2CommandBuilder.ConflictOption
member.summary: Gets or sets the the ConflictOption for this iDB2CommandBuilder.

remarks.para: Specifies which ConflictOption is to be used by the iDB2CommandBuilder for Update and Delete statements to resolve conflicting changes to the database.

The CompareRowVersion option is only supported on 6.1 and later hosts, and it requires the underlying table to include a row change timestamp field. Attempting to use this option when these requirements are not met will cause the behavior to revert to CompareAllSearchableValues.

The OverwriteChanges option causes only primary key fields to be used to identify the row changed for an Update or Delete. Use of this option is not recommended, because conflicting changes to the database will not be detected.

When using a CommandBuilder with a DataAdapter, the ConflictOption property must be set before the DataAdapter calls Fill or FillSchema. Otherwise, the resulting schema may not correctly reflect the contents of hidden columns, thus causing incorrect behavior during update operations.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2CommandBuilder.SchemaSeparator
member.summary: Gets the string used as the schema separator for this iDB2CommandBuilder. The value returned depends on the naming convention specified in the ConnectionString (System or SQL).
member.value: "." or "/" depending on the Naming property of the iDB2Connection.
